revised_title: The Role and Work of the R.A.F. Institute of Aviation Medicine
tldr: The R.A.F. Institute of Aviation Medicine investigates factors that impair the efficiency of flying personnel and their chances of safety or survival in emergencies. The institute focuses on two main disciplines, physiology and psychology, and conducts research on various aspects of flight, including high altitude physiology, environmental stress, and equipment design. The work of the institute is essential for improving the safety and efficiency of both military and civil aviation.
